result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Learned Treatise Motion
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO PRESERVE EVIDENCE

9:32 AM Defendant Sean Edward Seifert in court.  Attorney Patrick Joseph Stangl appeared by video for Sean Edward Seifert.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Stangl indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, Sawyer County Deputy Ryan Schick, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.  9:34 AM  Objection, Personal Narrative. Court sustained.   State continues examination.   9:38 AM Witness identified the DEF,  Court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  9:40 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Stangl.  9:46 AM Attny Stangl no further questions.  9:46 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.  State request for bind over.  Attny Stangl objects bind over.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.

State request Court address Justice Point.  Court reviews the Supervision Report, and DEF is in compliance.   

Arraignment scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment on December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Supervision Report - Justice Point
Letter to Judge re: request for Zoom appearance

11:36 AM Defendant Sean Edward Seifert in court.  Attorney Patrick Joseph Stangl appeared by phone for Sean Edward Seifert.  Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Stangl makes statement regarding hearing from March 29 and what bond conditions were amended.   Court reviews the court record and bond conditions.  Court indicates Justice Point was not be removed from bond as current bond is entered.   Attny Stangl agree misunderstanding with bond conditions.   Court indicates concerns with violation report filed, wording in second paragraph, last two sentences regarding electric monitoring and Huber information.    Court indicates orders filed by Attny Stangl will be denied.   Court orders - DEF to engage with Justice Point as of today 7/28/2022.  Next Court Appearance Card completed and given to DEF.
Bail/bond hearing on July 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
